reviews.review_msg:
Halil is definitely one of those prof where you either had an awful experience or you thought it was okay.

Imo, he seems to be more aware that most of us are here for SIAT, not architecture. So things were great until the A7 critiques, which were harsh.

As for 106, I blame the bad ratings on the course itself, so you just gotta pull through it.

Just do not take any courses with him if you have choices! He is so rude and never cares students. He is passive aggressive in his email, rude and cut people off when presenting. Also, he never makes his requirements clear, no one understand what he wants and gives low strict grades to students. mentally and physically in pain!!!!!(insert bad words

I took 106 with him before, and while it was hard, it was manageable. However, 233 is worse. His expectations are too high for non-architecture students. He doesn't adjust for canceled Monday classes and gives overlapping deadlines. The TAs are unhelpful due to poor communication on his side, assignments are vague, and he marks extremely hard.

Halil is a caring lecturer who wears painful rose-tinted glasses of expectation thinking that second-year IAT students are like fourth year architecture majors. The course content is difficult and will require heavy commitment outside of lecture to produce tangible final projects - and exams are needlessly difficult and unclear. But hey, he's nice.

Pushes unrealistic expectations on us, we are NOT the 4th yr, highly passionate, architecture students he imagines. Unfairly marks quizzes w/ criteria that was mentioned for 2 secs during unmemorable/dry lectures. Quiz 1-57 average, Quiz 2-52 average. Textbook taught me more than him. TA? awfully chosen. Dont be fooled by his wholesome dad demeanor

Halil is a great prof. Very responsive person with a great sense of humour. Unlike what's been said in some of the comments, he actually really cares about his students. I can tell he really wants you to do well in the class.
